article_title: Greece’s Lessons for an Indebted World
article_text:
Sovereign defaults are like cockroaches: There’s seldom just one.

Greece’s debts are so high, its recession so deep and its economy so uncompetitive, it’s easy to play down the lessons it offers to the rest of the world.

But while Greece is exceptional, the entire world is suffering from an overhang of debt. Since 2007, public debt in advanced economies (including national, state and local governments) has risen by 35...

twitter.description: Greg Ip’s Capital Account: While sovereign defaults tend to occur in waves, Greece’s recent woes needn’t be shared by other troubled countries.
twitter.title: Greece’s Lessons for an Indebted World
